sen.j: 棒術（ぼうじゅつ）は、日本武術において長い棒を武器とする術のことである。
sen.e: The term "Bojutsu" means an art of using a long stick as a weapon in Japanese martial art.
The term "Bojutsu" refers to the art of using a long stick as a weapon in Japanese martial arts.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: The term "Bojutsu" refers to the art of using a long stick as a weapon in Japanese martial arts.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 以下詳説する。
sen.e: Details are as follows.
Details are as follows.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Details are as follows.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 中国武術や琉球の武術においては、「棒」ではなく中央が若干太いいわゆる「棍」を使用し拳法の延長としての武器術として創意工夫された『棍術』（こんじゅつ）と称される術である。
sen.e: In the martial arts of China and Ryuku, it refers to the art which is called "konjutsu" (gun-shu), which uses what you call 'kon' with a little thick center instead of 'bo' (stick) and was devised as a martial art originated from kenpo (martial art by hands).

In the martial arts of China and Ryuku, it refers to the art which is called "konjutsu" (gun-shu), which uses what is referred to as 'kon' with a small thick center instead of 'bo' (stick) and was devised as a martial art that originated from kenpo (martial art by hands).
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: In the martial arts of China and Ryukyu, it refers to the art which is called "konjutsu", which uses a stick with the little thicker center known as a 'kon,' instead of 'bo' (staff), and was devised as a martial art that originated from kenpo (martial art by hands).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 世界各地に棒状の武器を使用する戦闘技法が過去に存在または伝来しており、それを日本では日本武術の棒術と類似するため棒術の語をあてる。
sen.e: The battle techniques to use a stick-shaped weapon existed or were introduced in various places of the world, which are called Bojutsu in Japan because of the similarity of the Bojutsu in Japanese martial art.

Martial techniques using a stick-shaped weapon existed or were introduced in various places across the world, which are called Bojutsu in Japan because of the similarity to Bojutsu in Japanese martial arts.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: Martial techniques using a stick-shaped weapon existed or were introduced in various places across the world, which are called Bojutsu in Japanese because of the similarity to Bojutsu in Japanese martial arts.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 日本武術の棒術の特徴 は、主として6尺（約180cm）前後の全て均一の太さで磨いて滑りやすくした断面が円形の棒を用いる武術である。
sen.e: The Bojutsu in Japanese martial art is characterized by a stick, which is circular in cross section and polished smoothly into an equal thickness of about 180cm.
Bojutsu in Japanese martial art is characterized by a stick, which is circular in cross section and polished smoothly into an equal thickness of about 180cm.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: Bojutsu in Japanese martial arts is characterized by a staff about 180 cm in length, which is circular in its cross section and smoothly polished.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 直径が八分（約2.4cm）～一寸一分（約3.3cm）のものが良く見られる。
sen.e: The one with about 2.4-3.3 centimeters in diameter is commonly seen.
Most sticks have a diameter of 2.4-3.3 centimeters.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: Most staff has a diameter of 2.4-3.3 centimeters.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: ただし流儀・流派によってはそれより長い、または短い、断面が円形でない、均一の太さではないなど様々である。
sen.e: However, there are various sticks such as longer or shorter stick or the stick which is not circular in cross section or unequal thickness, depending on styles and schools.
However, there are longer and shorter sticks, or sticks which are not circular in terms of their cross section; this depends on the styles and schools in which the sticks are used.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: However, there are longer and shorter staffs, or staffs which are not circular in terms of their cross section; this depends on the styles and schools in which the staffs are used.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 両端が太く、中央が細いものは鼓棒と呼ばれる。
sen.e: The one with think edges and thin center is called kobo.
Sticks with thick edges and a thin center are called kobo.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: Staffs with thick edges and a thin center are called kobo.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 現在4尺前後の棒を使う武術は『杖術』、さらに短い場合は『半棒術』として分けられる場合がある。
sen.e: At present the martial art which uses the stick of about 120cm is called "Jojutsu" and the one which uses shorter stick is called "hanbojutsu" (half-Bojutsu).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Presently, the martial art which uses a stick of about 120cm is called "Jojutsu" and arts which use a shorter stick are called "hanbojutsu" (half-Bojutsu).
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: Presently, the martial arts which use a staff of about 120 cm is called "Jojutsu" and those which use shorter sticks are called "hanbojutsu" (half-Bojutsu).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 棒の長さによる呼び名は流派によって様々であり、杖術も半棒術も棒術の一種である。
sen.e: The names based on the length of the stick are different among schools, and both Johutsu and hanbojutsu are a king of Bojutsu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The names based on the length of the stick are different among schools, and both Johutsu and hanbojutsu are a subset of Bojutsu.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: Different schools use different names for the sticks based on their respective lengths, and both Jojutsu and hanbojutsu are considered a subset of Bojutsu.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 棒の種類や材質・形態は様々で、日本に於いて『太平記』では柏木棒、樫木棒、金棒、鉄棒などが出現し、『義経記』では八角棒・乳切木など、特殊な形態の棒が記されている。
sen.e: There are various kinds of materials and forms of sticks in Japan; for example, in "Taiheiki" (The Record of the Great Peace) kashiwagibo (oak bar), kashinokibo (oak bar), iron club and tetsubo (iron bar) are seen, and in "Gikeiki" (a military epic about the life of Yoshitsune), the sticks with particular forms such as hakkakubo (octagonal bar) and chigiriki (a rather unique weapon of a short staff and a weight attached) are described.

There are various kinds of materials and forms of sticks in Japan; for example, the "Taiheiki" (The Record of the Great Peace) describes kashiwagibo (oak bar), kashinokibo (oak bar), iron club and tetsubo (iron bar), while in "Gikeiki" (a military epic about the life of Yoshitsune), unique sticks such as hakkakubo (octagonal bar) and chigiriki (a rather unique weapon consisting of a short staff and an attached weight) are described.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: There are various kinds of materials and forms of staffs in Japan; for example, the "Taiheiki" (The Record of the Great Peace) describes kashiwagibo (oak bar), kashinokibo (oak bar), iron club and tetsubo (iron bar), while in "Gikeiki" (a military epic about the life of Yoshitsune), unique sticks such as hakkakubo (octagonal bar) and chigiriki (a rather unique weapon consisting of a short staff and an attached weight) are described.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

tit.e: The origin of Bojutsu in Japan
The origin of Bojutsu in Japan
The origin of Bojutsu in Japan

sen.j: 古くから棒術は宗教とかかわりがあり、祭礼で棒術に相当するものが古くから行われている。
sen.e: It has related with religion since ancient times, and a kind of Bojutsu has been performed in rites and festivals.
Since ancient times, Bojutsu has been related to religion, and a kind of Bojutsu has been performed in rites and festivals.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: From old times, Bojutsu has been related to religion, and a kind of Bojutsu has been performed in rites and festivals.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: もっとも単純な武器の一つであり、その起源は古く、文献資料も剣術等に比べると少なく、良くわかっていない。
sen.e: It is one of the simplest weapons, and although it has an ancient root, its origin is not known well because of fewer historical sources and literatures than other martial arts such as swordplay,
While being one of the most ancient, and simplest weapons its origin is rather unclear due to fewer historical sources and literature than other martial arts such as Kenjutsu (swordplay).
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: While being one of the most ancient and simplest weapons, its origin is rather unclear due to fewer historical sources and literature than other martial arts such as swordplay.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: ただ、多くの流派で戦場で槍先、薙刀先を折られた時に、直ちにその柄をもって戦った事が発端となって編み出されたという謂れが伝わっている。
sen.e: However, many schools believe that it originated from the incident that when the point of spear or naginata (Japanese halberd) was broken in the battle field, a warrior fought with its handle immediately.

However, many schools believe that it originated from warriors having their spear point or naginata (Japanese halbred) broken while on the battle field, requiring them to immediately fight with the handle.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: However, many schools believe that they originated from warriors having their spear point or naginata (Japanese halbred) broken while on the battle field, who was required to immediately fight with the handle.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 多くの棒術流派で『ゴホウ(五法、五方、御方)』『サシアイ(指合、差合)』『カサノシタ(笠の下)』『（ゴリンクダキ）五輪砕』『（ミズヒキ）水引』等の技法名が共通している存在する事から、流派間に何らかの関連があると考えられている。
sen.e: Since many schools of bojutsu have common names of technique such as "goho" (literally, five methods, five directions, etc.), "sashiai" (literally, doing together, obstacle), "kasanoshita" (literally, under an umbrella), "gorinkudaki" (literally, crushing five wheels), and "mizuhiki" (decorative Japanese cord made from twisted paper), it seems that there are some relationships among schools.

Since many schools of bojutsu have common names for technique such as "goho" (literally, five methods, five directions, etc.), "sashiai" (literally, doing together, obstacle), "kasanoshita" (literally, under an umbrella), "gorinkudaki" (literally, crushing five wheels), and "mizuhiki" (decorative Japanese cord made from twisted paper), it seems that there is some relationship between schools.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: Since many schools of bojutsu have common names for techniques such as "goho" (literally, five methods, five directions, etc.), "sashiai" (literally, doing together, obstacle), "kasanoshita" (literally, under an umbrella), "gorinkudaki" (literally, crushing five wheels), and "mizuhiki" (decorative Japanese cord made from twisted paper), it seems that there has been some relationship among the schools.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

tit.e: The characters and techniques of Bojutsu
The characters and techniques of Bojutsu
The characters and techniques of Bojutsu

sen.j: 日本の棒術の特徴としては、他国の棒術のように棒対棒も存在するが、日本の他の武術種目と同じように、敵を剣術と想定している場合が多い事があげられる。
sen.e: Bojutsu in Japan is characterized by a general assumption of an enemy as well as other martial arts in Japan, although a game is sometimes performed by two players with sticks like the Bojutsu of other countries.

While Bojutsu in Japan also exist under the assumption that a given situation would involve two individuals carrying Bo, much like in Bojutsu found in other countries, forms also exist whereby it is assumed the opponent would be wielding a sword, as in other Japanese marital arts.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: While Bojutsu in Japan also exist under the assumption that a given situation would involve two individuals carrying Bo, much like in Bojutsu found in other countries, forms also exist under the assumption that the opponent would be wielding a sword, as in other Japanese marital arts.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 棒術の由来で述べたように、槍や薙刀などから生まれたといわれる流派が多く、槍術・剣術・薙刀術の操法と共通項がある事が多い。
sen.e: As mentioned in the section of the origin of Bojutsu, many schools are said to have originated from spear and naginata, and often have common techniques with the art of the spearmanship, swordsmanship, and naginata.

As mentioned in the section concerning the origina of Bojutsu, many schools are said to have originated from spear and naginata, and often have techniques in common with the art of spearmanship, swordsmanship, and naginata.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: As mentioned in the section concerning the origin of Bojutsu, many schools are said to have originated from spear and naginata, and often have the techniques in common with the art of spearmanship, swordsmanship, and naginata.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: そのためか長物を扱うための基本とされ重要視されている例も多い。
sen.e: Because of this, it is often emphasized as the base to treat long weapons.
For this reason, it is often considered the foundation for wiedling pole arms.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: For that reason, it is often considered the foundation for wielding polearms.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: (例：竹内流、気楽流など)
sen.e: (For example, Takenouchi school and Kiraku school)
(For example, Takenouchi school and Kiraku school)
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: (e.g., Takenouchi school and Kiraku school)
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: また、柔術の流派の多くで棒術を含んでいたり、または他流の棒術を併伝している例が多くみられる。
sen.e: In addition, many schools of jujutsu (classical Japanese martial art, usually referring to fighting without a weapon) include Bojutsu or use Bojutsu from other schools.
In addition, many schools of jujutsu (classical Japanese martial art, usually referring to fighting without a weapon) include Bojutsu or use Bojutsu from other schools.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In addition, many schools of jujutsu (classical Japanese martial art, usually referring to fighting without a weapon) have their own Bojutsu or use Bojutsu from other schools.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 古くから、身体を作るのには棒術が良いと言われている。
sen.e: Since ancient times, it has been said that Bojutsu is good for making a body.
Since ancient times, it has been said that Bojutsu is an excellent method for forging the body.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: From old times, it has been said that Bojutsu is an excellent method for building up the body.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 講道館創始者嘉納治五郎も修行時代に柳生心眼流の棒術やその他の棒を学び、その効用を認めている。
sen.e: Jigoro KANO, the founder of The Kodokan Judo Institute, learned the Bojutsu of Yagyushingan school and other Bojutsu during his training period, and admitted its utility.
Jigoro KANO, the founder of The Kodokan Judo Institute, learned Bojutsu from the Yagyushingan school and other Bojutsu during his training period, and admitted its utility.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: Jigoro KANO, the founder of the Kodokan Judo Institute, learned Bojutsu from the Yagyushingan school and other Bojutsu during his training period, and admitted its utility.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: (失敗に終わったが、後に杖術、棒術を講道館に取り入れようとした)
sen.e: (Although it failed, he tried to introduce Jojutsu and Bojutsu at The Kodokan Judo Institute later)
(Although he failed, he tried to introduce Jojutsu and Bojutsu at The Kodokan Judo Institute later)
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: (Although he failed, he tried to introduce Jojutsu and Bojutsu at the Kodokan Judo Institute later)
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 日本国内の棒術を含む総合武術の中には、その教練体系内でこの術を「間合いの操作を学ぶためのもの」と位置づけているところもある。
sen.e: Some comprehensive martial arts including Bojutsu in Japan consider this as 'a subject to learn adjusting the timing' in its curriculum.
Some comprehensive martial arts including Bojutsu in Japan consider this as 'a subject to learn timing and distancing' in its curriculum.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: Some schools of comprehensive martial arts including Bojutsu in Japan consider Bojutsu as 'a subject to learn timing and distancing' in its curriculum.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: これはその総てが柄であり総てが刃となる、棒という武器の特質と深い関わりがあると言えよう。
sen.e: It could be said that this is deeply related with the character of stick as a weapon all of which can be seen as a handle and a sword at the same time.
It could be said that the nature of the stick lends itself to being seen as a handle, and in turn a sword, and as such is a very deep subject.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: It could be said that the above description has deep relations with the nature of the staff such that the staff can function as a handle and also an edge.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 武士以外と棒術
sen.e: People except samurai and Bojutsu
People except samurai and Bojutsu
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: People other than samurai and Bojutsu
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 棒術はその特性上、身分、階層を問わず広く修練されており、日本各地に多くの流派が存在した。
sen.e: Bojutsu has been practiced broadly without regarding status and class because of its character, and many schools existed in various places of Japan.
Bojutsu has been practiced by many without regard for status and class because of its character, and many schools existed in various places of Japan.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: Bojutsu has been practiced widely without regard for status and class because of its character, and a lot of schools have appeared in various places of Japan.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 現在でも祭礼で棒術が棒の手や棒術、棒踊り、獅子舞などと呼ばれ演じられる例が多くある。
sen.e: Even now, Bojutsu is often performed in rituals and festivals, called Bo no te (Japanese traditional dance), Bojutsu, bo-odori (bar dance) and shishimai (lion dance).
Even now, Bojutsu is often performed in rituals and festivals, called Bo no te (Japanese traditional dance), Bojutsu, bo-odori (bar dance) and shishimai (lion dance).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Even now, Bojutsu is often performed in rituals and festivals by the names of Bo no te (Japanese traditional dance), Bojutsu, bo-odori (bar dance) and shishimai (lion dance).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 場合によっては、祭礼で演じられるが、伝承形態は武術そのものとして伝わっている例も散見される。
sen.e: Some of them are succeeded as a martial art, although they are sometimes performed in rituals and festivals.
Some of them succeeded as a martial art, although they are sometimes performed in rituals and festivals.
sen.cmt: Edited for flow
sen.e: Some of them have succeeded as a martial art, although they are sometimes performed in rituals and festivals.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: その他多くの流派が棒の手、獅子舞、棒踊りや祭りの露払いとして地方に伝わっている。
sen.e: In addition, Bojutsu of many schools has been succeeded as Bo no te, shishimai, bo-odori and outrider of festival in various regions.
In addition, Bojutsu of many schools succeeded as Bo no te, shishimai, bo-odori and outrider of festival in various regions.
sen.cmt: Edited for flowRobert: "outrider of festiva"makes no sense
sen.e: In addition, Bojutsu of many schools have succeeded as Bo no te, shishimai, bo-odori and a herald of festival in various regions.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。
